snippet: A decrease in death rates from suicide, homicide and cancer has contributed to the smallest gap in life expectancy between blacks and whites in history.
abstract: National Center for Health Statistics says life expectancy gap between blacks and whites fell to 3.4 years in 2014, smallest in history, with 75.6 years for blacks and 79 years for whites; life expectancy gains for black Americans are attributed in part to reductions in infant mortality, suicide and smoking.
lead_paragraph: A decrease in death rates from suicide, homicide and cancer has contributed to the smallest gap in life expectancy between blacks and whites in history.

headline.main: Black Americans See Gains in Life Expectancy
headline.print_headline: Black Americans Narrow the Gap in Life Spans
